etymology.description: 天(天) (tiān, "heaven; sky") + 氣(氣) (qì, "air; atmosphere") = refers to the state of the atmosphere or 'weather'
etymology.interpretation: The word 天氣(天氣) (tiānqì, "weather") combines 天(天) (tiān, "heaven; sky") with 氣(氣) (qì, "air; atmosphere") to describe the atmospheric conditions we experience. This concept connects the natural elements of the sky and atmosphere with weather patterns.

examples.chinese: 今天天氣很好(今天天氣很好)。
examples.english: The weather today is very good.

examples.chinese: 我们在公园散步(我們在公園散步)，享受宜人的天氣(享受宜人的天氣)。
examples.pinyin: Wǒmen zài gōngyuán sànbù, xiǎngshòu yírén de tiānqì.
examples.english: We take a walk in the park, enjoying the pleasant air.

examples.chinese: 清晨的天氣凉爽(清晨的天氣涼爽)，适合跑步(適合跑步)。
examples.pinyin: Qīngchén de tiānqì liángshuǎng, shìhé pǎobù.
examples.english: The early morning weather is cool, perfect for running.
